Question: You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead without stopping
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive slower than 100km/h
Do not drive faster than 100km/h unless the road is clear
Do not drive faster than 100km/h
A rest area is 100 metres ahead

Question: What must you do before turning left into a driveway?

Answers.Answer: Check the driveway is clear and enter
Signal only if there is a vehicle behind you and enter
Signal for 3 seconds or more and if the driveway is clear, enter
Signal only if another vehicle is coming towards you and enter

Question: What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Brake suddenly to warn them
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Question: What does this traffic signal mean?

Answers.Answer: Drive on before the signal changes to red
Drive on because the signal will turn green
Stop if you can do so safely
Stop only if traffic is in the way

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing without a raised traffic island, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians on your side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on any part of the crossing
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all oncoming traffic

Question: You may park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if you:

Answers.Answer: leave your keys in your vehicle
have someone stay with the vehicle who can move it
leave a note on the vehicle saying ‘Back soon’
will not be away from the vehicle for more than 5 minutes

Question: When coming up to a one-lane bridge, what does this sign indicate?

Answers.Answer: You must slow down
You must give way
Others should give way to you
You must stop

Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: The passengers themselves
The parents of the passengers
You as the driver of the vehicle
Other passengers in your vehicle

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?

Answers.Answer: 1 metre
2 metres
3 metres
4 metres

Question: You must turn your headlights on when visibility is less than:

Answers.Answer: 100 metres
120 metres
140 metres
160 metres

A motorbike
A truck with dangerous goods
A bus

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: When driving into bright sunlight, you should use sunglasses and your vehicle sun visors for safety. What else are you advised to do?

Answers.Answer: Turn the headlights of your vehicle on
Drive safely on the far left of the road
Look at and drive close to the centre of the road
Pull over or stop and wait for a few minutes

Question: What must you do if you want to turn right at traffic signals where a green light is showing?

Answers.Answer: Push your way through the vehicles coming towards you
Give way to vehicles coming towards you
Wait until the lights change to red and then turn quickly
Turn at once as the vehicles coming towards you will be stopped

Question: If anybody is hurt in a crash, the driver must tell a police officer as soon as possible but within:

Answers.Answer: 24 hours
36 hours
48 hours
60 hours

Question: What should you do if you are driving and become sleepy?

Answers.Answer: Drive on the far left side of the road
Move off to the left of the road and have a rest
Speed up so that you can get home quickly
Keep on driving but use a lower gear

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may not pass
Only trucks may park here
You may stop for no more than 5 minutes
No vehicles may stop here

Question: When should you use your hazard lights?

Answers.Answer: When your vehicle becomes a temporary hazard to other road users
Before changing lanes
When approaching an accident scene to warn other drivers
When reversing from a driveway and your view is not clear

Question: You wish to make a right turn on a narrow country road. There is a vehicle coming towards you and traffic behind you. What is the safest option?

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
Decide not to turn and drive straight ahead
Move to the left side of the road and turn when the road is clear

Answers.Answer: You may turn right
You may go straight ahead

You may turn left or right

Yes – if you put a white flag on the right-hand corner
Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer
No – not at all

False

Question: Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
